therapy cards.prompt: choose a member of the group to be yr parent and ask them something that is difficult for you to request
have the group form an interlocked circle; starting on the outside, become a member of the group.
lie on the floor. let the group cradle you. go with the experience.
let the warmth you feel toward a member of the group really show.
talk abt yr occupation in the way that you might when you feel it is meaningful; now in the way you might when you feel it is not meaningful.
embrace each member of the group as honestly as possible.
choose a member of the group to be a police officer. tell them what you think of them as if there would be no consequences.
stand up. select someone. go totally limp in their arms.
without using words, show a member of the group that you want them to like you.
pick a member of the group and try to make them laugh.
tell the group what effect you think being extremely wealthy would have on you.
exaggerate yr habitual posture. now move in the way this makes you feel.
try to give an objective and accurate description of the way you look
one at a time, sit close to each member of the group. look into their eyes and say something you like abt them.
sing a little dong of yr own invention abt yrself
stand up and tell the group what makes you mature
choose a way in which you are particular and exaggerate it
one at a time, tell each member of the group a significant way in which you are similar to them
starting with the word 'chair' free associate for abt 30 seconds
describe a significant way in which you use yr friends
exaggerate yr childish qualities
contract all the muscles in yr body from scalp to toes. hold this for at least 30 seconds
tell each member of the group a way in which you would like to know them better
choose a new name for yrself and explain why it would be more fitting than the one you have now
